enrichment.AboutCourse:
The Eatock Primary Cluster School Direct programme will be delivered by good and outstanding practitioners in a highly supportive and aspirational environment. The programme is aimed at developing your skills, knowledge and understanding required for teaching within the classrooms of tomorrow. \r
\r
The majority of training will be delivered by the Eatock Cluster School Partners and Edge Hill University. The programme supports trainees to develop innovative and creative approaches to teaching in a supportive environment. Trainees will be provided with classroom based experiences which will enable them to reflect on pedagogy in practice. \r
Edge Hill University’s teaching and learning experience is of the highest quality, with a curriculum that is inspiring, relevant and informed by the outcomes of up to date research. As part of your School Direct experience, you will have access to state of the art facilities at Edge Hill University’s Ormskirk campus and regular interaction with fellow PGCE trainees.\r
\r
Why join the Eatock Primary Cluster?\r
\r
We offer our Initial Teacher Training (ITT) trainees an outstanding School Direct programme which includes the following: \r
* School led professional learning.\r
\r
* High quality training provided by Eatock and other primary schools within the Eatock Primary Cluster.\r
\r
* A high quality teacher training programme and support from Edge Hill University.\r
\r
* Individual support and mentoring by good and outstanding practitioners within their own school. \r
\r
* First-hand experience of Learning Outside the Classroom and how to use it to enhance teaching and learning. \r
\r
* PCGE Primary Education with QTS Qualification (60 credits) – Working with both Eatock Primary Cluster and Edge Hill University you will work towards your QTS qualification. \r
enrichment.Qualifications:
* Qualifications - GCSEs at grade C or above (or equivalent qualification) in English Language and Mathematics prior to application. We also require GCSE at grade C (or equivalent qualification) in Combined Science / Physics / Chemistry / Biology and two additional National Curriculum subjects (as taught in Key Stages 1 and 2).\r
* Degree - A first or second class Honours degree from a UK university.\r
* Personal and presentational qualities - including a good standard of written English\r
enrichment.InterviewProcess:
Eatock Primary School is the lead school in the partnership and will be coordinating the recruitment process. This will involve a full day within one of our Partner schools and will include:\r
•\t20 minute observed teaching activity \r
•\tAn interactive school tour\r
•\tAn interview\r
•\tA written task\r
Prior to your interview day, you will be informed of the content of the activity and the age group you will be teaching. Our Interview team will consist of Senior leaders from the Eatock Primary Cluster schools and Edge Hill University staff.\r
The rigorous and thorough process is aimed at recruiting trainees of the highest calibre.\r
enrichment.OtherRequirements:
* All students will have a Enhanced DBS check before undertaking the course. \r
\r
* School Experience - A commitment to, and understanding of, primary education, normally founded on at least 10 days of experience in primary classrooms in the two years prior to your application\r
\r
enrichment.PersonalQualities:
* At Eatock we are looking for students who have previous experience of working with primary aged children. \r
\r
* We are looking for students who can demonstrate: commitment, resilience, good communication skills, a commitment to teaching and a desire to be the best classroom practitioner they can be. You must also be well organised and enthusiastic.
enrichment.HowSchoolPlacementsWork:
All schools within the Eatock Cluster work closely to ensure that each student experiences what it is like working in a school on a day to day basis. Students are welcomed into classrooms and encouraged to get involved with the life of the school. \r
\r
During the course you will undertake two long term placements (November - February and April - June). As well as these placements you will attend ten enhancement days at Eatock and in some of our partner schools. \r
\r
All schools within are cluster are based in Wigan and Bolton. \r
\r
We have single and two-form entry schools. \r
\r
All placements will take place in Primary Schools and will be based in classes from Year 1 upwards.

AccreditingProviderEnrichments.Description:
Edge Hill University is based on an attractive, award-winning 160-acre campus in Lancashire, close to Liverpool and Manchester. \r
\r
The institution’s significant success in achieving its mission is recognised by a range of awards and high rankings for teaching, student experience, accommodation and more. Edge Hill is ranked as Gold in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF), the government’s evaluation of excellence in teaching quality, learning environment and student outcomes. The University is also one of the select few to have held the coveted UK University of the Year title, awarded by Times Higher Education (2014/15).
